Hello friends,
This will likely be the last update to this project but not the last Wrylon communique. I've launched a 2nd Kickstarter project to publish three Wrylon notebooks, chock full of even more 'bots. 
Please feel free to check it out here.

updates.update_userinfo: Mailing List is Live!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
I hope everyone out there is doing great! The Kickstarter campaign is winding down. I sent out what I believe is the last lost/missing/dead-letter-office book this morning and I'm diving into the commissions. 
And I'm working on more Wrylon stuff and trying to figure out what, exactly, the next project will be.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update
updates.update_content:
(At least I think so.)
With the exception of a couple local deliveries, all books & associated swag have shipped as of 8:30 this morning. I'm pretty stoked. I do want to apologize for this book going out somewhat later than intended. I'd been aiming for a December delivery and I was able to make a December shipping date. Some of ya'll have gotten them by now & your comments & reactions have been very gratifying. Thank you.

updates.update_userinfo: All books shipped!
updates.update_content:
I have everything from the printer...everything but the bellybands. 
Due to some confusion they're not ready yet. Much more importantly - and tied into the bellybands not being ready - the inserts are not inserted into the books. There was some miscommunication regarding who would be the extra materials. I thought it would be them, they thought it would be me. 
Turns out it's going to be me.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping has begun!
updates.update_content:
Alright, so I've finally gotten a firm date from my printer. Next Tuesday, the 11th. 
That's much later than I'd hoped or expected but it's what it is. 
I have one vacation day left for 2012 & I'm taking it on that Friday, the 14th. I'm going to work like crazy to try and get every book shipped by the following Monday. The math almost works out (using round numbers) - 600 orders @ 10 min. per package = 100 hours of shipping, not including driving to the post office (I have a little car, which means many trips). Will each package take 10 min.? Probably not but there's signing and stamping on every book, there's making sure the proper number of stickers & patches are in each, there's double checking addresses...Actually 10 min. sounds low. Gulp.

updates.update_userinfo: Have the books! (mostly)
updates.update_content:
Hey gang,
I hate to lead with a downer but there's no sense in pretending that they're totally on time. I don't have a new, solid ETA yet but I will make sure all of you know as soon as I know. I'm sorry. It's partially my fault, as I went into an extra round of printed proofs but I still thought they'd be done and shipping by now. Nevertheless, I'm going to take the optimistic route and cross my fingers that everyone will have theirs by the holidays. I do apologize for the uncertainty.

campaign.story:
What is the Free Art Machine?
The intrepid inventors at Chicago The Beautiful have produced a marvelous machine, a Free Art Machine.  This incredible instrument, this miraculous mechanism, produces free art fantastically for just a dollar a unit!  But we need your help to kickstart the Free Art Machine and keep it running...
The Free Art Machine is a project envisioned by two Chicago artists and their arts initiative, Chicago The Beautiful. The goal of the project is to produce thousands of pieces of free art made with public submissions, for distribution in various creative ways. The project will support local Chicago artists while simultaneously cultivating art appreciation.
Why?
The most exciting part of the Free Art Machine is how it self-amplifies.  Once it starts running, all donations are fed back into the machine and converted into free art.  This art will draw more viewers and artists to contribute, producing more and more art.
Artists can reach art-lovers via the Free Art Machine.  When the art-lover finds a piece that speaks to them, they can pull it off the wall and keep it. The artist's information will be on the back of the block, putting the art consumer in direct contact with their new favorite artist. They will then have the opportunity to view and purchase more work from that artist.
So the machine functions as a forum for artists and art appreciators, as well as a catalyst which stimulates third-party exchanges of art beyond The Free Art Machine's initial function.
The Art
The photo block is our first design for free art. It is a 3.5" x 3.5" x .75" block of wood with a photo securely adhered to the front. On the back will be the edition number, artist's initials and a drilled hole for hanging (thumbtack size). Every image will be made in limited quantities to ensure uniqueness. We are looking upon the abundant talent in this city to flood our inbox with great art. We have open submissions for the free art machine, so send the images you think would make great free art.
Send your images via our easy to use UPLOADER
or Email us at info@chicagothebeautiful.com
Distribution
Chicago The Beautiful will be working with cafes, restaurants, and other venues to display walls of free art. We will install and stock the location with free art. Depending on the venue we will decide on the size of the wall, and how many blocks to supply.
To start, six locations around Chicago will be selected to host a free art wall. For example, one of these will be the Jupiter Outpost Cafe in Chicago's West loop. We will spread out the locations to make sure we cover Chicago. If you are in charge of a space in Chicago make sure to contact us to host an art wall.
Each free art wall includes a donation box, the money collected will be used to produce more art and keep the free art machine alive.
Studio 914 and Chicago the Beautiful will be hosting many free art events at the CTB workshop/gallery space in West Town, Chicago. The nights will feature original Chicago art, free food, live music, and free art.
 We are looking to you to come to us with your space, ideas and visions for ways that free art can be distributed and appreciated.
Our Philosophy
We believe art is free. Art is everywhere, and like nature, its beauty is both timeless and personal. The act of discernment and appreciation is the starting point for finding this True beauty. Our aim is to inspire these acts of awareness in everyone for their better understanding of the inherent beauty all around us.
Cost Breakdown
All pledges are divided 50/50 between free art and the production of rewards.
- 50% toward production of free art pieces: At $1 per unit, $100 will produce 100 pieces of free art. If we meet our kickstarter goal, the Free Art Machine will produce 4000 pieces of free art for distribution in cafes, art galleries, and at unique events. As an example, if we receive $50,000, the Free Art Machine will produce 25,000 pieces of free art.
- 50% toward production of rewards: The funds received for production of the rewards includes minimal labor costs, ensuring that even with a massive number of orders our hand-made products will be delivered on time. Local Chicago artists and artisans can quickly be employed to help with the timely production of your rewards.
Rewards
Ya gotta work with what ya got. This what we do, and we are offering it to you in the name of free art.
The rewards will be hand-crafted products and services produced by the two artists who first envisioned the project, plus free art produced by the Free Art Machine.  Rewards include photo mounting / resin coating services.
Resin Framing Service - Resin frames are high quality photo prints on handmade wooden frames coated in a two-part epoxy polymer resin.  This seals the print and protects it from the damaging effects of water and UV rays.
-Our printing is done on a Lambda printer using Kodak Endura paper at 400dpi.
For more information visit:
www.chicagothebeautiful.com
www.914california.com
Please contact us, we'd love to hear from you,
Leo and Max
info@chicagothebeautiful.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge posed to the project will be staying on schedule if we are flooded with orders and contributions. Suppose we receive $80,000 from Kickstarter, we would be faced with the obstacle of how to produce 40,000 pieces of free art, in addition to the $40,000 worth of resin coating services. Doing all that in a timely manner will require an expansion and rearrangement of our operation, but we are prepared. Local artists and artisans from our community can step in quickly to fill the work force gap. Free art pieces can be contracted to talented artists around the country, and the resin service can be performed by novice artisans under our supervision in our Chicago workshop. We've done the math and we're ready.

The second challenge will be finding adequate venues for distribution. In our experience this will be a lesser issue. Many cafes throughout Chicago are happy to host individual artists on their walls, let alone host a wall of free art without any loss to their business. The free art walls have a magical attractive power that most any retail business owner can see the value in.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone. We are working our hardest to get the final batch of orders out. There was a delay with the resin blocks because we ran into some issues with workspace and quality.  We had to redo a bunch of orders.  But we are committed to sending you pristine looking resin products so we've had to troubleshoot these problems before we could continue.  We are proud to say that things are looking beautiful again and we are trying to ship out almost all of the remaining orders this week. 
We really appreciate everyone's patience and we apologize for the extreme delays. Please try to understand that almost all of the work is hand-made by just the two of us in a small workshop. We hope you'll be happy with the results despite the extended wait time.

campaign.story:
I created an Alphabet Book four years ago, called 'A Fine Book of Letters.' My inspiration was the flowers and animals from my daily life. Doves, bunnies, mice, nasturtiums, violets, etc. I live in a truly lovely place, on a river in Southeastern MA, and am grateful to the special creatures and plants with whom I share my home for their inspiration and unconditional love. This book is how I share that feeling with the children for whom I wrote it.
 'A Fine Book of Letters'
I had a small number of copies of 'A Fine Book of Letters' printed. I sold all of them, printed some more and sold all of them too. Bookstores, friends, and fans are clamoring for more. Now I have had the book redesigned by a professional book designer.
New Cover Design
I have a quote from a local printer for 500 copies and all I need is your help get this project to press. If you aren't able to watch the video and would like to see more of the letters, here is a selection:
B is for Booker Bunny, with a bell, before bluets and a butterfly. (I have kept bunnies all my life. Booker was a truly fabulous bunny, so here he is, in all his glory.)
F is for Fenway Frank, a fanatical Red Sox fan, who hangs out with the players and sleeps behind the scoreboard. (I am a devoted fan of the Red Sox. I love to listen to the games while I paint.)
I is for iris, and for inimitable Ira, who works at a florist shop. (I have been drawing mouse characters since I was a kid and they are often featured in my cards and in my little prints.)
J is for Junco, and for Jack-in-the-Pulpit.
K is for Kingfisher, knowledgeable about knapweed.
M is for mice, maneuvering the Moon.
N is for Nuthatch, negotiating nasturtiums.
R is for Rosie, with her rocks and Rosa rugosa.
That's the story of how this project began, and where it will go. It would mean the world to me if you supported my project.

The editions are small, only 100 prints per letter, but at the moment there are plenty available of each letter. And, again, if any of you did not get your reward, PLEASE let me know.

updates.update_userinfo: Checking in after a year
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
     It has been a little over a year since my project funded and I want to make sure that those of you who signed up for rewards received them. I  tried to keep track as I sent them out, but there is always the chance that I missed someone. So, please let me know. 
     I had one package returned as "not deliverable as addressed". Nicole Peters, if you get this email, please contact me.

updates.update_userinfo: Packages going out!
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody,
 The book arrived about a week ago and I am now busy sending out your copies. I have sent out requests to all backers for the information I need to fulfill your rewards. Please get that info back to me as soon as possible and if you need the books and/ or letters for holiday presents please let me know that, too. This little elf wants everybody to be a happy as she is.

updates.update_userinfo: THE BOOK HAS ARRIVED!!!!
updates.update_content:
Hi People,
     The book has been delivered and it is beautiful. I am so proud of it and so grateful to all of you who helped. I have a show this Friday and Saturday in Chestnut Hill (MA), but will be home on Sunday and will start sending out books.
     So, if you are due to receive one or two or however many your reward is email me your mailing address if you haven't already and let me  know if you want the book signed generically or to a particular person. If that person is a child and you want me to sign it to them on their page (e.g. "H" is for hummingbird and also for Henry!) let me know that, too. It is certainly possible to sign one book to siblings, just let me know.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on printing of book
updates.update_content:
Hi Everybody,
      I thought I had left an update last week, but apparently I didn't actually post one. Anyway, I considered all the quotes I had from printers and decided to go with the original one, but to upgrade from digital printing to offset. It is a bit more than I raised, but it will be a really wonderful book And, I can make up the difference. My book designer A.Michelle and I went over the proof yesterday and will get it back to my printing rep on Monday. We should have the first few copies for the Hatch Street Holiday Sale, New Bedford, MA the weekend after Thanksgiving and the rest the following week so I can start fulfilling rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: Project Finale
updates.update_content: This project completes tomorrow, October 1st - at around 9:00 PM, I think - and I just want to thank all of you, again, who have supported this project and shared it with other people who have supported it. This has been an incredible experience for me. I have had wonderful emails with numerous old friends, been introduced to new friends - received exposure for my art I never would have gotten, and been contacted by a couple of printers. I am committed by choice to using a US printer and with the money we have raised I will make sure I get the best print job available.

updates.update_userinfo: The Finish Line is in sight and we are Golden!
updates.update_content: Thank you all so much for all the pledges, facebook postings,encouraging comments and emails. We have made the goal and then some.We are grateful for any late pledges and all the additional money will go towards upgrading the printing.  This has been one of the most interesting and affirming experiences in my career as an artist. You have made my dream come true. A thousand Big Fat THANK YOUS!

updates.update_userinfo: We are very, very close!
updates.update_content:
Hey folks,
     We are at 98%! I am thrilled and profoundly touched by everyone's generosity. If we go over the goal, which I think we might, I will use the extra money to upgrade the printing. I will keep you all posted. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
